ALLEGIANCES.Defintion: loyalties and beliefs (especially to a country or leader)

BASE.Defintion: the main place from where an army or organisation controls their activities

BLINDFOLD.Defintion: a piece of cloth that covers your eyes

BUFFER.Defintion: something that protects another thing from something else

CHARM.Defintion: being easily able to attract others

COMPOUND.Defintion: a residential area surrounded by a wall, often used for the military

DISGUISE.Defintion: something you wear to change your appearance and make yourself look like someone else

DOWNFALL.Defintion: the end of a person or organisation

EXILE.Defintion: sent away from your own country

EXPANSE.Defintion: a large open stretch of land

FACTIONS.Defintion: groups (normally within a larger groups), typically with different characteristics or views

FOOTHOLD.Defintion: a position from which you can make progress

MOB.Defintion: large group or crowds, especially violent ones

MOBS.Defintion: large groups or crowds, especially violent ones

NICHE.Defintion: very specific and only interesting to a small group of people

OFFENCE.Defintion: behaviour that makes someone angry or upset

PROXY-WAR.Defintion: a war fought between smaller groups on behalf of larger groups

PUPPET.Defintion: a person who is controlled by someone else

UPRISING.Defintion: when the people of a place rise up against those people in power

WHETTED YOUR APPETITE.Defintion: makes you want to do something again (or in greater detail)

WITH OPEN ARMS.Defintion: in a friendly and welcoming way
